full_text: Date: 9/01/06 Time: 13:38:06 PALM BEACH POLICE DEPARTMENT Incident Report Page: 4 Program: CMS301L report these incidents because he was not sure the money was accounted for. Possible footage of the incident may exist. I next met with Kellen who advised she went to bed at approximately 1130 pm on 10/4/03 and did not hear or see anything unusual through the night or on the morning of 10/5/03. Cotrin, the resident chef advised that he went to bed at approximately 1030 pm on 10/4/03 and began work at approximately 6:20 am on 10/5/03. Cotrin stated that he did not see or hear anything unusual from the staff residence locate don the east side of the property. I next spoke to Mike and Rosalie Friedman who are the house managers. Mike stated that he went to the staff residence at approximately 8:30 hours on 10/4/03 and got up at approximately 11:30 pm the same night to move the Mercedes into the garage. Mike said he returned to the residence at approximately 6:20 am on 10/5/03 but did not notice anything unusual. Rosalie stated that she checked the exterior of the residence at approximately 7:30pm on 10/4/03 as part of her duties. Rosalie stated at that time, she saw no one and everything appeared in order. Rosalie stated she left the main house at approximately 11:30 pm and returned at approximately 8:30 on 10/5/03. It should be noted that Mike and Rosalie Friedman have been employed as the house managers since 9/24/03. Prior to them, the live on site house managers were Patrick and Evelyn, Epstein was unsure of the last name. Patrick Evelyn were employed at 358 El Brillo approximately 9 months. Prior to the house manager was John Alessi who was employee at 358 El Brillo approximately 10 years. Epstein signed an affidavit of prosecution, it is attached to this report. Crime Scene manager Parkinson responded and processed the scene. Det. Melnichok also responded. See Det. Melnichok's report for further information. Officer Nault responded and conducted a neighborhood canvas which is also attached to this report. It should be noted that Epstein will contact Palm Beach Police Department with the serial number of the stolen handgun so that it may be entered into FCIC. ****************** NARRATIVE # 2 ****************** GREENE Reported By: MELNICHOK, THOMAS C. 10/06/03 Entered By.: GREENE, LINDA C. 10/06/03 On 10/05/03, at 1000 hours, I responded to 358 El Brillo Way reference a burglary that had occurred at the residence during the night. Upon my arrival, I met with the homeowner who verbally identified himself as Jeffrey Epstein, DOB 01/20/53. Epstein told me that over the last couple of months, when he has come into town, he has money he had left in his carry on bag, has turned up missing. Epstein said he wasn't sure of the amount of money in the carry on bag on any specific incident and thought that he possibly had misplaced the money. Epstein 07/26/17 Page 20 of 111 Public Records Request No.: 17-295 DOJ-OGR-00031430

****************** NARRATIVE # 2 ****************** GREENE Reported By: MELNICHOK, THOMAS C. 10/06/03 Entered By.: GREENE, LINDA C. 10/06/03

On 10/05/03, at 1000 hours, I responded to 358 El Brillo Way reference a burglary that had occurred at the residence during the night. Upon my arrival, I met with the homeowner who verbally identified himself as Jeffrey Epstein, DOB 01/20/53. Epstein told me that over the last couple of months, when he has come into town, he has money he had left in his carry on bag, has turned up missing. Epstein said he wasn't sure of the amount of money in the carry on bag on any specific incident and thought that he possibly had misplaced the money. Epstein
